summary: The document is a confidential report concerning a covert site in Bethesda, Maryland, under the President John F. Kennedy Assassination Records Act of 1992. It presents a security survey that identifies potential security hazards at the site, such as its ground-floor location with windows and proximity to a parking lot, and specifies measures to safeguard against the compromise of activities. The report also contains diagrams of the site and its surroundings, along with biographical information on individuals linked to the site, noting that no derogatory information was found in the Office of Security Indices. It strictly prohibits the storage or loan of classified material at the site without prior approval.
key_findings: The covert site is situated on the ground floor of an apartment building in Bethesda, Maryland, presenting security risks due to ground-level windows and nearby parking.
No significant or derogatory information was uncovered about the individuals associated with the site in the Office of Security Indices.
Classified materials are strictly forbidden from being stored or loaned at the covert site without prior authorization.
Included are detailed diagrams of the covert site's building and its vicinity, as well as biographical details of related individuals.
keywords: President John F. Kennedy Assassination Records Act
